instructions.title: SURFACE PREPARATION
instructions.data:
Surface to be painted should be clean and dry, free from dust, dirt, and other foreign matter.
Hammer all nails deep enough to apply putty.
Open grain wood can be filled with wood filler.
Sand surface until wood is smooth to the touch.
Dust off surfaces completely then wipe with a clean rag.

instructions.title: PAINTING SCHEDULE
instructions.data: Using a brush, apply BOYSEN®® Oil Wood Stain to bare wood without primers or undercoats. Lightly brush or wipe over once along the grain to remove excess material and to smooth out any runs. Leave each coat for about 4-8 hours or until totally dry. Recoat for a darker shade. Apply intermediate coat using BOYSEN®® Lacquer Sanding Sealer B‑1254, sanded lightly before topcoat application. Apply clear topcoat using either BOYSEN®® Clear Gloss Lacquer B‑1250, Clear Dead Flat Lacquer B‑1253, or Water White Clear Gloss Lacquer B‑1258 depending on the preferred finish.

instructions.title: NOTES
instructions.data: Use only BOYSEN®® Lacquer Thinner B‑50 as thinning solvent. Thoroughly shake the BOYSEN®® Oil Wood Stain can before opening. If necessary, add approximately 10% by volume of BOYSEN®® Lacquer Flo B‑1205 to the ready-to-use topcoat mixture.

calculator.title: Intermediate Coat
calculator.item: BOYSEN®® Lacquer Sanding Sealer B‑1254

calculator.title: Thinning Solvent for Sealer and Topcoat
Lacquer products applied using conventional spray gun.
